    • Method Detail

      • breakpoint

        public void breakpoint(Channel channel,
              java.lang.Object associate,
              java.lang.String message,
              java.lang.Object... args)
        Description copied from interface: Debugger

        Informs the debugger that the thread under debug has reached a breakpoint. This method should be called only by the agent, never by an external thread. The call blocks if the breakpoint is in the #pausingChannels. It unblocks only after someone calls the debug control functions such as #run().
        If we notice the runmode is SteppingDebugger.RunMode.KILLED, ThreadDeath is thrown.

        *

        Usage of breakpoint():
        A call to breakpoint() may be inserted BEFORE the agent action takes place, so the debugger can indicate what the system is going to do, as well as AFTER the agent action has taken place. Doing so enables a programmer to see what is scheduled to happen BEFORE the action occurs, and to check what has happened after the action has been performed in order to identify any problems due to the action and in order to facilitate an effective analysis (this allows a programmer to check its expectations).

        IMPORTANT: do NOT place a #breakpoint(String, Channel, Object) inside a synchronized block if you want to support multi-threading.

        It is recommended to use past tense for breakpoints reporting an event that has happened, and to use future tense for events that are going to happen after the breakpoint.

        Specified by:
        breakpoint in interface Debugger
        Overrides:
        breakpoint in class SteppingDebugger
        Parameters:
        channel - channel on which to the breakpoint message is reported. Also see class Channel.
        associate - The object being associated with the breakpoint. May be null if the breakpoint is not associated with any object. See GOALProgram#getBreakpointObjects() for which IParsedObjects the user can put a breakpoint on.
        message - is a user-readable message that describes the breakpoint event.
        args - Any additional arguments to embed in the message

      • notifyObservers

        protected void notifyObservers(Channel channel,
                   DebugEvent event)
        Updates observers that subscribed to a channel with the debug information related to that channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel to send information on.
        event - Debug event provided to observers subscribed to the channel.

      • setRunMode

        public void setRunMode(SteppingDebugger.RunMode mode)
        Description copied from class: SteppingDebugger
        Changes the run mode. Only notifies observers of a change in run mode.

        Also wakes up the debugged thread of the agent, to check if it can proceed running.

        Overrides:
        setRunMode in class SteppingDebugger
        Parameters:
        mode - The run mode for the debugger.

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(DebugObserver observer,
             Channel channel)
        add channel to viewed channels. Your observer will be notified when debug event happens on that channel.
        Parameters:
        observer -
        channel -
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given observer is not subscribed to this SteppingDebugger (or the given observer is a BreakpointObserver).

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(DebugObserver observer)

        Removes the observer from the list of registered observers.

        Parameters:
        observer - observer to be removed from registered observer list.

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(DebugObserver observer,
               Channel channel)
        remove channel from viewed channels. Your observer not will be notified anymore when debug event happens on that channel.
        Parameters:
        observer - is observer that wants to stop viewing the channel
        channel - is channel to be removed from view.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given observer is not subscribed to this SteppingDebugger (or the given observer is a BreakpointObserver).

      • isViewing

        public boolean isViewing(DebugObserver observer,
                Channel channel)
        Check if observer is viewing given channel.
        Parameters:
        observer - is observer that might be viewing
        channel - is channel that might be under observation.
        Returns:
        true if under observation, false if not.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given observer is not subscribed to this SteppingDebugger (or the given observer is a BreakpointObserver).

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: SteppingDebugger
